Does anyone have experience running ethstats?
I'm trying to run it such that ~35 nodes send data to it and a couple dozen people are viewing it. But it seems to keep crashing on me with this:
```
<--- Last few GCs --->

[17:0x55ed42b09b80]    20548 ms: Mark-sweep 744.2 (783.4) -> 594.2 (632.3) MB, 241.3 / 0.0 ms  (+ 7.8 ms in 1 steps since start of marking, biggest step 7.8 ms, walltime since start of marking 2852 ms) allocation failure GC in old space requested


<--- JS stacktrace --->

==== JS stack trace =========================================

Security context: 0x1d6e72c25e91 <JSObject>
    1: range [/eth-netstats/node_modules/lodash/index.js:~11497] [pc=0x3b257c627bf6](this=0x3ada9ae43941 <JSFunction lodash (sfi = 0x3aa70387ce39)>,start=14735282,end=235510465,step=1)
    2: arguments adaptor frame: 2->3
    4: getHistoryRequestRange [/eth-netstats/lib/history.js:648] [bytecode=0x3d40c4e4b471 offset=120](this=0x336e2e343b71 <History map = 0x282aa6ab3bb9>)
    6: /* anonymous */...

FATAL ERROR: invalid table size Allocation failed - JavaScript heap out of memory
```

I've tried increasing the heap with `"NODE_OPTIONS=--max-old-space-size=4096"` (also tried higher values like 20000 and so on) and that doesn't seem to help. My JS knowledge is quite fuzzy, anyone got any ideas as to what the culprit may be? Or who I could potentially ask for help? ðŸ˜„
